TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit RouteCollection extends System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection`1<class System.Web.Routing.RouteBase>
Public Class RouteCollection Inherits Collection(Of RouteBase)

summary.span: 提供 ASP.NET 路由的路由集合。

span.span: Provides a collection of routes for ASP.NET routing.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类提供了使你能够管理的派生自的对象的集合的方法类。The class provides methods that enable you to manage a collection of objects that derive from the class. 通常，将使用`static`属性类检索对象。Typically, you will use the `static` property of the class to retrieve a object. 属性存储 ASP.NET 应用程序的所有路由。The property stores all the routes for an ASP.NET application. ASP.NET 路由循环访问中的路由要查找的路由与 URL 匹配的属性。ASP.NET routing iterates through the routes in the property to find the route that matches a URL. 若要构造的 URL，请调用方法并传入值的集合。To construct a URL, you call the method and pass in a collection of values. 方法找到具有与传入的并返回的值匹配的参数的第一个路由对象，其中包含有关匹配的路由的信息。The method finds the first route with parameters that match the values that you passed in, and returns a object that contains information about the matching route. 你检索该 URL 通过属性对象。You retrieve the URL through the property of the object. 你可以添加具有名称或没有名称的路由。You can add a route either with a name or without a name. 包括一个名称，可区分类似路由构造 Url 时。Including a name enables you to distinguish between similar routes when URLs are constructed. 如果不指定一个名称，ASP.NET 路由使用的第一个匹配路由集合中来构造 URL。If you do not specify a name, ASP.NET routing uses the first matching route in the collection to construct a URL. 当您添加到未命名的路由对象，无法添加已位于集合中的路由。When you add an unnamed route to the object, you cannot add a route that already is in the collection. 当你将添加命名的路由时，不能使用已标识在集合中的路由的名称。When you add a named route, you cannot use a name that already identifies a route in the collection. 你使用方法和方法以确保你与不会从其他进程的冲突的集合交互。You use the method and the method to make sure that you interact with the collection without conflicts from other processes. 有关如何将路由添加到路由集合的详细信息，请参阅[ASP.NET 路由](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/892441af-8f1d-483e-ab5f-b82c23576f5a)。For more information about how to add a route to a route collection, see [ASP.NET Routing](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/892441af-8f1d-483e-ab5f-b82c23576f5a).

summary.span: 向 对象末尾添加路由，并为该路由分配指定的名称。

span.span: Adds a route to the end of the object and assigns the specified name to the route.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法使您能够将其添加到路由集合时定义为路由的名称。The method enables you to define a name for a route when you add it to the route collection. 通过定义路由的名称，可以指定要在你使用路由构造 URL 时使用的特定路由。By defining a name for the route, you can specify a particular route to use when you use routing to construct a URL. 当多个路由匹配的值传递给指定的特定路由是重要方法。Specifying a particular route is important when more than one route matches the values that you pass to the method. 如果未指定命名的路由，ASP.NET 路由将使用的值匹配的集合中的第一个路由。If you do not specify a named route, ASP.NET routing will use the first route in the collection that matches the values. 有关详细信息，请参阅[如何： 从路由构造 Url](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/1ffd4085-71f6-4822-be8f-f682ca638650)。For more information, see [How to: Construct URLs from Routes](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/1ffd4085-71f6-4822-be8f-f682ca638650). 可以使用名称中仅一次对象。A name can be used only one time in the object. 如果不需要指定路由的名称，则可以通过调用添加路由方法。If you do not have to specify a name for the route, you can add the route by calling the method. 使用方法和方法以确保你与不会从其他进程的冲突的集合交互。Use the method and the method to make sure that you interact with the collection without conflicts from other processes. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何将添加到的路由对象，并为该路由分配一个名称。The following example shows how to add a route to a object and assign a name to the route. [!code-csharp[System.Web.Routing.RouteCollection.MapPageRoute#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/system.web.routing.routecollection.mappageroute/cs/global.asax#1)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Routing.RouteCollection.MapPageRoute#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/system.web.routing.routecollection.mappageroute/vb/global.asax#1)]

is already used in the collection.

summary.span: 提供一个对象，用于管理在集合中检索对象时的线程安全性。

span.span: Provides an object for managing thread safety when you retrieve an object from the collection.

returns.span: 用于管理线程安全性的对象。

span.span: An object that manages thread safety.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 对象可供在应用程序中的多个进程。The object is available to multiple processes in the application. 因此，如果你需要的应用程序运行时检索路由，则使用方法，以确保的线程安全性。Therefore, if you have to retrieve a route when the application is running, use the method in order to guarantee thread safety. 通过获取路由集合上的读取的锁定，请确保你尝试对其进行检索时，将不修改集合。By obtaining a read lock on the route collection, you make sure that the collection will not be modified while you are trying to retrieve it. 方法将继续，直到锁线程停止。The method stops the thread from continuing until the lock can be acquired. 位置的写入锁时，线程等待，直到已更新，并写入锁被释放。If a write lock is in place, the thread waits until the update is completed and the write lock is released. 释放路由集合读取的锁时释放此方法返回的对象。The read lock on the route collection is released when the object that is returned by this method is disposed. 如果不使用，阅读时可能会出现错误集合。If you do not use , you might get an error while you are reading through the collection. 例如，假设循环访问中的对象集合来阅读它们，而不调用。For example, suppose you loop through the objects in the collection to read them, without calling . 尽管你执行该操作时，可能调用另一个线程从另一个请求并将路由添加到集合。While you are doing that, another thread from another request might call and add a route to the collection. 然后，第一个线程将失败并出错。The first thread will then fail with an error. 有两种方案，在其中你无需调用:There are two scenarios in which you do not have to call : - 公共方法的类如和调用内部。Public methods of the class such as and call internally. 因此，不需要显式调用当调用的公共方法类来从集合中检索数据。Therefore, you do not have to explicitly call when you call a public method of the class to retrieve data from the collection. - 当应用程序将从开始，未尚未处理请求，如在`Application_Start`事件处理程序中，只有一个线程正在运行。When the application is starting and is not yet processing requests, such as in the `Application_Start` event handler, only one thread is running. 由于不有阅读它时，可能会更新集合的任何其他线程，则不需要调用。Because there are no other threads that might update the collection while you are reading it, you do not have to call . ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用方法时的应用程序运行时检索路由。The following example shows how to use the method when you retrieve a route while the application is running. `Using`语句可确保，无论会发生什么情况在运行时，当你从集合中读取 （无论代码正常完成还是引发异常） 将安全地释放锁末尾`Using`代码块。The `Using` statement ensures that no matter what happens at run time when you read from the collection (whether the code completes normally or an exception is thrown) the lock will be safely released at the end of the `Using` code block.

summary.span: 提供一个对象，用于管理在集合中添加或删除元素时的线程安全性。

span.span: Provides an object for managing thread safety when you add or remove elements in the collection.

returns.span: 用于管理线程安全性的对象。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在 ASP.NET 应用程序内定义路由的建议的方法是将添加到的路由的事件处理程序中的属性`Application_Start`Global.asax 文件中的事件。The recommended approach for defining routes in an ASP.NET application is to add the routes to the property in an event handler for the `Application_Start` event in the Global.asax file. 有关详情，请参阅。For more information, see . 如果你需要运行应用程序时添加路由，则使用若要确保线程安全的方法。If you have to add a route when the application is running, you use the method to guarantee thread safety. 释放路由集合写入锁时释放此方法返回的对象。The write lock on the route collection is released when the object that is returned by this method is disposed. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用应用运行时添加路由的方法。The following example shows how to use the method when you add a route while the application is running.

summary.span: 定义不需检查是否匹配路由的 URL 模式。

span.span: Defines a URL pattern that should not be checked for matches against routes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法创建映射到的路由路由处理程序。This method creates a route that is mapped to the route handler. 调用此方法后，与指定的 URL 模式匹配的请求将不会处理作为路由请求。After you call this method, requests that match the specified URL pattern will not be processed as route requests. URL 与匹配的物理文件，如图像文件时，ASP.NET 路由自动忽略请求。ASP.NET routing automatically ignores requests when the URL matches a physical file, such as an image file. 在某些情况下你可能还想路由以在没有任何物理文件时忽略发出请求。In some cases you might also want routing to ignore requests when there is no physical file. 例如，ASP.NET 自动使.axd 文件的请求不应被视为请求路由即使没有对应于.axd 文件扩展名的物理文件。For example, the requests that ASP.NET automatically makes for .axd files should not be treated as route requests even though there is no physical file that corresponds to the .axd file-name extension.

span.span: Defines a URL pattern that should not be checked for matches against routes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法创建映射到的路由路由处理程序。This method creates a route that is mapped to the route handler. 调用此方法后，与指定的 URL 模式匹配的请求将不会处理作为路由请求。After you call this method, requests that match the specified URL pattern will not be processed as route requests. URL 与匹配的物理文件，如图像文件时，ASP.NET 路由自动忽略请求。ASP.NET routing automatically ignores requests when the URL matches a physical file, such as an image file. 在某些情况下你可能还想路由以在没有任何物理文件时忽略发出请求。In some cases you might also want routing to ignore requests when there is no physical file. 例如，ASP.NET 自动使.axd 文件的请求不应被视为请求路由即使没有对应于.axd 文件扩展名的物理文件。For example, the requests that ASP.NET automatically makes for .axd files should not be treated as route requests even though there is no physical file that corresponds to the .axd file-name extension. ## Examples MVC 项目的默认模板使用此方法来避免.axd 文件路由，如下面的示例中所示：The default template for MVC projects uses this method to exclude .axd files from routing, as shown in the following example: [!code-csharp[MvcDefaultApp#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/mvcdefaultapp/cs/global.asax.cs#2)] [!code-vb[MvcDefaultApp#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/mvcdefaultapp/vb/global.asax.vb#2)]

member this.Ignore : string * obj -> unit

param.name: url
param.span: 要忽略的 URL 模式。

span.span: The URL pattern to be ignored.

param.name: constraints
param.span: 附加条件，用于确定是否忽略匹配 URL 模式的请求。

span.span: Additional criteria that determine whether a request that matches the URL pattern will be ignored.

summary.span: 定义一个 URL 模式，此模式在请求 URL 满足指定约束的情况下不需要检查 URL 是否与路由匹配。

span.span: Defines a URL pattern that should not be checked for matches against routes if a request URL meets the specified constraints.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法创建映射到的路由路由处理程序。This method creates a route that is mapped to the route handler. 调用此方法后，与指定的 URL 模式匹配的请求将不会处理作为路由请求。After you call this method, requests that match the specified URL pattern will not be processed as route requests. URL 与匹配的物理文件，如图像文件时，ASP.NET 路由自动忽略请求。ASP.NET routing automatically ignores requests when the URL matches a physical file, such as an image file. 在某些情况下你可能还想路由以在没有任何物理文件时忽略发出请求。In some cases you might also want routing to ignore requests when there is no physical file. 例如，ASP.NET 自动使.axd 文件的请求不应被视为请求路由即使没有对应于.axd 文件扩展名的物理文件。For example, the requests that ASP.NET automatically makes for .axd files should not be treated as route requests even though there is no physical file that corresponds to the .axd file-name extension. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用此方法来忽略具有.aspx 扩展名的所有 Url。The following example shows how to use this method to ignore all URLs that have an .aspx extension. 你可能想要执行此操作，如果你注册自定义 HTTP 处理程序处理的文件具有扩展名".aspx"的所有 Url。You might want to do this if you register a custom HTTP handler to handle all URLs for files that have the extension ".aspx". 如单个的 URL 模式将匹配所有.aspx 请求需要两个通用参数`{*path}.aspx/{*pathinfo}`。A single URL pattern that would match all .aspx requests would require two catchall parameters such as `{*path}.aspx/{*pathinfo}`. （此模式将匹配任何.aspx，包括那些具有查询字符串参数中结束的 URL。）但是，路由结束时，只有一个通用参数。(This pattern would match any URL that ends in .aspx, including those that have query-string parameters.) However, routing allows only one catchall parameter at the end. 作为替代方法，你可以指定只有一个通用参数相匹配的所有 Url 的 URL 模式，然后指定排除不具有.aspx 扩展名的所有内容，如下面的示例中所示的约束：As an alternative, you can specify a URL pattern that has a single catchall parameter that matches all URLs and then specify constraints that exclude everything that does not have the .aspx extension, as shown in the following example: ```vb routes.Ignore("{*allaspx}", new With {.allaspx = ".*\.aspx(/.*)?"}) ``` ```csharp routes.Ignore("{*allaspx}", new {allaspx=@".*\.aspx(/.*)?"}); ``` 之前的代码行通常将添加到从调用的方法`Application_Start`方法在 Global.asax 中的示例所示重载。The previous line of code would typically be added to a method that is called from the `Application_Start` method in the Global.asax, as shown in the example for the overload.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用方法和方法以确保你与不会从其他进程的冲突的集合交互。Use the method and the method to make sure that you interact with the collection without conflicts from other processes.

summary.span: 获取或设置指示标准化虚拟路径时是否将 URL 转换为小写的值。

span.span: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether URLs are converted to lower case when virtual paths are normalized.

value.span: 将 URL 转换为小写，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: to convert URLs to lower case; otherwise .
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果在 URL 中包含查询字符串，该 URL 的一部分不会转换为小写。If a query string is included in the URL, that part of the URL is not converted to lower case.

summary.span: 提供用于定义 Web 窗体应用程序的路由的方法。

span.span: Provides a way to define routes for Web Forms applications.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 提供此方法是为了方便编码。This method is provided for coding convenience. 它等效于调用方法并传入通过创建的对象类。It is equivalent to calling the method and passing a object that is created by using the class. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用此方法定义的 Web 窗体应用程序的路由。The following example shows how to define routes for a Web Forms application by using this method. 该示例演示一个名为方法`RegisterRoutes`从调用`Application_Start`Global.asax 文件中。The example shows a method named `RegisterRoutes` that is called from `Application_Start` in the Global.asax file. 该方法使用的每个重载将路由添加到应用程序。The method uses each overload of to add a route to the application. 有关如何定义 Web 窗体应用程序的路由的详细信息，请参阅[如何： 为 Web 窗体应用程序定义的路由](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/200fe812-d0a6-4531-b9b4-cfc4ee83a678)。For more information about how to define routes for Web Forms applications, see [How to: Define Routes for Web Forms Applications](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/200fe812-d0a6-4531-b9b4-cfc4ee83a678). [!code-csharp[System.Web.Routing.RouteCollection.MapPageRoute#122](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/system.web.routing.routecollection.mappageroute/cs/global.asax#122)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Routing.RouteCollection.MapPageRoute#122](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/system.web.routing.routecollection.mappageroute/vb/global.asax#122)]

summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，它指示 ASP.NET 路由是否应处理与现有文件匹配的 URL。

span.span: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether ASP.NET routing should handle URLs that match an existing file.

value.span: 如果 ASP.NET 路由操作处理所有请求（甚至包括与现有文件匹配的请求），则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if ASP.NET routing handles all requests, even those that match an existing file; otherwise, .
The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 尽管可以动态更改此值，在使用 ASP.NET 路由集成时，将忽略激活服务之后所做的任何更改。Although this value can be changed dynamically, any change made after a service has been activated will be ignored when using ASP.NET routing integration. 有关详细信息，请参阅[ASP.NET 路由集成](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=195235)。For more information, see [ASP.NET Routing Integration](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=195235).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当您添加到未命名的路由对象，无法添加已位于集合中的路由。When you add an unnamed route to the object, you cannot add a route that already is in the collection. 使用方法和方法以确保你与不会从其他进程的冲突的集合交互。Use the method and the method to make sure that you interact with the collection without conflicts from other processes.

is already in the collection.
